column4: okay - I'm running KDE (originally installed kubuntu) but I've had enough of it.  How can I install the gnome desktop from apt-get?  the stupid KDE "Add/Remove Programs" doesn't even give an option to install the gnome desktop stuff.
sudo apt-get install gnome
or try gnomedesktop
but might i advise you to look into the xfce desktop before you do gnome?
xfce?  why?  isn't that a remote control system?
ah, you mean a totally different desktop.
xfce is a lightwight GUI that looks both better and works better then gnome and kde. just a tip. look at their url before you do gnome.
part of the ubuntu universe, or do I have to download and install from them?
http://www.xfce.org/ check it out. i think you can add some stuff in the repository list and do the sudo apt get
sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop
ah, this is the default desktop for xubuntu.
indeed
kubuntu = kde, ubuntu = gnom, xubuntu = xfce
well, the gnome install is...installing.  I'll pull the trigger on xfce when it's done and take a look.
sure thing
once you get bored of thouse check out blackbox and fluxbox
lol...and then call my friend Bill in Redmond.
lol lets not talk about that one. then i would need to get the cyklon b and load up my gas chamber he he
originally, I liked the KDE interface...but **** it's restrictive and not as useful as it appears at first glance.
i know. its like windows. you are like me. you want it sleek, usefull and looking good. you will probably end up using xfce.
but its okey. try them all. its nice experience
